Title: Towards Fraudulent URL Classification with Large Language Model based on Deep Learning
Abstract: the issue of fraud has become increasingly prevalent with personal information frequently obtained through web addresses resulting in a high incidence of fraud. traditional machine learning methods or black and white lists are often employed to classify urls involved in fraudulent activities however these methods are time consuming and often yield poor results. to address this the present study introduces a novel approach utilizing language models to detect fraudulent websites with a focus on interpretability analysis and ultimately the application of the model to a server.
